Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Tilt \Tilt\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Tilted}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Tilting}.] To cover with a tilt, or awning. [1913 Webster]
tilted adj : departing or being caused to depart from the true vertical or horizontal; "the leaning tower of Pisa"; "the headstones were tilted" [syn: {atilt}, {canted}, {leaning}, {tipped}]
